intro: Heliotropium salsum, commonly known as saltbush heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in sandy or saline soils, demonstrating a high tolerance for coastal conditions. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually violet or purple in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Heliotropium salsum is adapted to thrive in environments with high salinity and salt spray, making it an important species in coastal ecosystems.
